quest.name: Victory in Peril
journal: Ghimthota, a captain of the watch at the Moraby Drydocks, wishes your aid in dealing with potential intruders.

Ghimthota is convinced that a gang of treacherous pirates aims to sabotage the construction of the Victory. Speak with either Urswyrst at the front gate or C'nangho at the rear gate to learn of any suspicious activity.
You have spoken with one of the guards and heard a report concerning a possible saboteur. Make your way to the cliff at Empty Heart and learn what trouble is afoot.
You have confronted the suspicious sailor, and he leaves you with words that send a chill down your spine. Hurry back to the Drydocks and report to Ghimthota.

You have succeeded in preventing the destruction of the Victory. It has come to light, however, that the leader of the pirates, Ahtzapfyn, is actually Ahtbyrm's father. Speak with the troubled foreman, and see how he fares.
Though he puts on a brave face, it is clear that Ahtbyrm is deeply shaken by his father's unexpected appearance. Return to Ghimthota and convey Ahtbyrm's gratitude and apologies.

Ghimthota appears convinced that a swift return to work on the Victory will soon ease Ahtbyrm's troubled heart. The watch captain thanks you for your assistance, and mentions that the would-be saboteurs have been handed over to the Yellowjackets. There has, however, been an important discovery that she would like to discuss with you.
objectives: Speak with one of the guards.
Report to Ghimthota at the Moraby Drydocks.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: I am concerned, Forename. It appears that the pirates I had you investigate are on the move.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: They creep ever closer to the Drydocks, so I must assume they mean to target the Victory herself.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: That ship is the symbol of everything Limsa Lominsa strives to become, and I will not allow these base scoundrels to lay a single finger upon her hull.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: We must apprehend them before they put their plans into motion! And you, Forename, are just the womanman to do it.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Without your capable assistance, I fear the security of the Drydocks cannot be guaranteed.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Not moments ago, my guards submitted reports of suspicious activity in the area. Pray begin your efforts by listening to one of their accounts firsthand.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: It matters not whom you choose to speak with, but be sure to question either Urswyrst at the front gate or C'nangho at the rear.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Any suspect saboteurs you encounter during the course of your investigation are to be interrogated. Report any and all findings directly to me.

dialogue.name: URSWYRST
dialogue.text: Ghimthota sent you to follow up on my report?

dialogue.name: URSWYRST
dialogue.text: Well, it was not too long ago that I saw some unsavory sort slinking along the top of the bluff near Empty Heart, just over yonder.

dialogue.name: URSWYRST
dialogue.text: It may be that he's still about. If you've got the time, adventurer, I'd much appreciate you getting up there to take a look.

dialogue.name: CNANGHO
dialogue.text: Hail, adventurer. Glad to have another hand aboard to help shore up security.

dialogue.name: CNANGHO
dialogue.text: The gods know our reports would sit on Ghimthota's desk gathering dust if it weren't for the assistance of those such as yourself.

dialogue.name: CNANGHO
dialogue.text: Speaking of reports, though, I saw one of those mangy pirates lurking around the cliff near Empty Heart. I'd take a closer look before he has a chance to cover his tracks.

dialogue.name: CORSAIRFOLLOWA
dialogue.text: Bah, spotted me, did ye? Well, yer too late─what's to 'appen is already 'appenin'.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Victory in Peril”?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: So, you found me one of those pirates, did you?

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: I knew you were the right adventurer to ask for aid.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: But what could these knaves be planning? “What's to happen is already happening”...?

dialogue.name: MAELSTROM
dialogue.text: Captain! Ungh... Trouble...at the shipyard... <pant>

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Easy now, soldier. Who did this to you?

dialogue.name: MAELSTROM
dialogue.text: <pant> Pirates... Out of nowhere... <cough> Stuck me good...

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Gods below, we are not prepared for this!

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: The pirates, soldier, how many do they number?

dialogue.name: MAELSTROM
dialogue.text: Not sure... More than I could quickly count... Seemed to be carrying...explosives...

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Explosives!? Then there is no time to lose!

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Forename, you heard the situation. Make your way to the shipyard and engage these intruders!

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: I will see to this man's wounds, then follow after.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Make haste, now!

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: Gahahaha! Never reckoned it'd be this easy! Still don't trust those slimy bastards, but their plan worked like a charm!

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: Da! What are you doing, you great bloody fool!?

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: Shut yer trap, boy.

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: This'll all be over soon. All that's left now is to blow this ugly pile o' driftwood into splinters.

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: Why would you do such a thing!? Have you any idea how important this ship is? What it represents?

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: Aye, an' that's what makes it all the sweeter! Whatever it takes to knock some sense into me treacherous, backstabbin' son!

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: Imagine, a boy o' mine givin' up the pirate life to become a shipwright! An' buildin' a bleedin' Maelstrom vessel at that! What under Llymlaen's wide, green ocean made ye take up with these self-righteous shites!?

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: You're the one with no bloody sense, Da! Don't you see? The pirates had their glory days, but that era is over!

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Ah! I wondered why Ahtbyrm never spoke of his father. I never would have thought...

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: This ship's a symbol alright─of everythin' what went wrong with the world. An' I mean to shatter it into a hunnerd thousand pieces!
Ghimthota! Forename! Pray beat the tar out of this bloated sea slug, and make sure no harm comes to the Victory!

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: I...I must be gettin' old, lettin' some green 'venturer get the best o' me.

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: Da...

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: <cough> That's one big bloody ship. Big...an' nasty lookin'. Ye made that, did ye...?

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. I shudder to think what may have become of the Victory without your intervention.

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: <sigh> The pirates have made a right mess of things─I'd best get to sorting out the docks.

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: ...And my thoughts could use some sorting out as well. Ever did my father have a way of turning my life upside down.

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: Pray convey my thanks─and my apologies─to Ghimthota.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: How fare you, Forename? I cannot begin to thank you for the role you played in preventing this madness.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: You defended more than a simple ship─you saved the budding hope of Limsa Lominsa from a violent demise. The day was yours.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: It seems our security regimen will require much in the way of improvement if we are to truly keep the Drydocks safe.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: ...Ahtbyrm apologizes? Well, I suppose I can understand why he would feel responsible for his father's actions. Of all those involved, this incident was hardest on him.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: But, in time, I believe he will come to a single conclusion: the most fitting way of moving past his anguish is to see the Victory completed and in the water.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Ah, by the by, the pirates we defeated have been handed over to the Yellowjackets. Reyner's men will be taking over the investigation.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Before the Yellowjackets moved in, however, we recovered a most unusual object. Should you have the time to spare, I would ask of you another favor...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the pirates and protect the Victory!

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: Da, this is madness!

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: A pirate don't abandon 'is treasures!

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: My father... You must stop him!

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text:
Leave him to us.
Forename, C'nangho, to me!

dialogue.name: MAMOOJA
dialogue.text: As we agreed, Ahtzapfyn!

dialogue.name: CNANGHO
dialogue.text: Mamool Ja mercenaries!?

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: I'll take the Mamool Ja. You focus on Ahtzapfyn.

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: Ye've no idea who yer up against!

dialogue.name: AHTZAPFYN
dialogue.text: Now, outta me damn way!

dialogue.name: AHTBYRM
dialogue.text: Please! You cannot let him win!

dialogue.name: CNANGHO
dialogue.text:
Ware, adventurer!
Ahtzapfyn has a crazy glint in his eye...

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Protect the ship...

dialogue.name: CNANGHO
dialogue.text: Captain, I...ugh...
